    Author:
    Felix Project Team

    • Method Detail

      • prepare

        public void prepare(byte[] origin)
             throws IOException
        Checks the given bytecode, determines if the class was already manipulated, and collect the metadata about the class.
        Parameters:
        origin - the bytecode
        Throws:
        IOException

      • manipulate

        public byte[] manipulate(byte[] origin)
                  throws IOException
        Manipulate the given byte array.
        Parameters:
        origin - : original class.
        Returns:
        the manipulated class, if the class is already manipulated, the original class.
        Throws:
        IOException - : if an error occurs during the manipulation.

      • isAlreadyManipulated

        public boolean isAlreadyManipulated()
        Checks whether the class was already manipulated.
        Returns:
        true if the class was already manipulated, false otherwise

      • toQualifiedName

        public static String toQualifiedName(String clazz)

      • getManipulationMetadata

        public Element getManipulationMetadata()
        Compute component type manipulation metadata.
        Returns:
        the manipulation metadata of the class.

      • extractInnerClassName

        public static String extractInnerClassName(String clazz)
        Extracts the inner class simple name from the qualified name. It extracts the part after the `$` character.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the qualified class name
        Returns:
        the simple inner class name

      • getFields

        public Map<String,String> getFields()

                         MethodDescriptor md)
        Adds a method to an inner class.
        Parameters:

        md - the method descriptor to add

      • prepareInnerClass

        public void prepareInnerClass(String inner,
                     byte[] bytecode)
                       throws IOException
        Analyzes the given inner class.
        Parameters:
        inner - the inner class name
        bytecode - the bytecode of the inner class
        Throws:
        IOException

      • manipulateInnerClass

        public byte[] manipulateInnerClass(String inner,
                          byte[] bytecode)
                            throws IOException
        Manipulates the inner class. If the outer class was already manipulated does not re-manipulate the inner class. We consider that the manipulation cycle of the outer and inner classes are the same.
        Parameters:
        inner - the inner class name
        bytecode - input (i.e. original) class
        Returns:
        the manipulated class
        Throws:
        IOException - the class cannot be read correctly

      • getMethodsFromInnerClass

        public List<MethodDescriptor> getMethodsFromInnerClass(String innerClassInternalName)

      • getInnerClassesAndMethods

        public Map<String,List<MethodDescriptor>> getInnerClassesAndMethods()
